item.title: Containers
item.description: What are Containers? A small taste A container is a software that packages software and code with all of it’s dependencies. This allows an application to run from one environment to another seemlessly. Popularized in 2013, a Docker container image is lighter than a VM, is standalone and can execute everything you need to run an application: code, runtime, system tools, system libraries and settings. There are various form of containers (lmctfy, Turbo, Docker, ROCKET, among others), but in this entry we will mostly focus on Docker’s version.
